meanings.definition: A large extent, amount, or number
meanings.sent1: There were a lot of apples in the basket.
meanings.sent2: She has a lot of toys in her room.
meanings.sent3: I ate a lot of ice cream and now I feel sick.
meanings.sent4: He had a lot of courage to face his fears.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had a lot of patience with her students.

meanings.definition: A piece of land used for a specific purpose
meanings.sent1: The farmer owns a lot of land for growing crops.
meanings.sent2: They are building a house on that empty lot.
meanings.sent3: I bought a lot of land to start my own farm.
meanings.sent4: The lot next to the park is for sale.
meanings.sent5: The lot by the river is perfect for a picnic.

meanings.definition: A group of items sold together at an auction
meanings.sent1: She bid on a lot of antique furniture at the auction.
meanings.sent2: The auctioneer presented a lot of paintings for sale.
meanings.sent3: I won a lot of books in the auction.
meanings.sent4: The lot included a variety of jewelry pieces.
meanings.sent5: The auction had a lot of interested buyers.

meanings.sent1: It was his lot to become a great leader.
meanings.sent2: She accepted her lot in life with grace.
meanings.sent3: Winning the lottery was his lucky lot.
meanings.sent4: Their meeting was a twist of fate, a shared lot.
meanings.sent5: She believed in shaping her own lot through hard work.
